jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist/Economist - Supply
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, we’re Back Market.

We’re here to help make tech reliable, affordable, and better than new. We're a global marketplace for refurbished devices, helping lower our collective environmental impact by providing trustworthy, affordable tech with 92% less carbon emissions than new.

Yep, you read that right. Turns out refurbished tech is way better for the planet than new. In fact, With every device purchased on Back Market, our positive impact on the planet grows. From our Customer Care representatives to our software engineer, every individual at Back Market cuts the planet — and consumers — a break. Our mission is simple: to do more with what we already have.

Are you ready to join us?


About the Role

You'll be our marketplace economics expert, using advanced analytics and causal inference to tackle our biggest strategic questions. Where will growth come from next? How does competition shape our pricing? Which incentives unlock more supply? How do inventory levels affect customer experience?

Your insights will directly influence decisions across our Supply and Pricing teams, helping shape how we operate in markets around the world.

What You'll Do

  • Build causal inference models to understand supply and pricing drivers across markets and products

  • Develop measurement frameworks to assess the real impact of our marketplace policies

  • Lead cross-functional projects with Supply, Pricing, Business, and Engineering teams

  • Establish best practices for causal inference and mentor other analysts

  • Create scalable frameworks and automated tools to support decision making and enable teams to run their own analyses

What You Bring

  • 4-8+ years applying causal inference and statistical methods to business problems

  • Advanced SQL & Python (and/or R)

  • Experience driving strategic decisions through cross-functional collaboration

Bonus Points

  • Digital marketplace, e-commerce, or two-sided platform background

  • Track record building analytics capabilities in growing organizations

  • Experience with DBT and Tableau

** We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement listed above. We value diverse experiences and are committed to helping you grow in areas where you may have less experience.

Interview Process

  • Initial Screening with Marie, 45 min

  • Technical Interview Live challenge , 60 min

  • Team Fit Interview with Bastien and Coline, 45 min

  • Stakeholders Discussion , 60 min

  • Cultural Fit , 45 min

Ready to help us change how the world consumes technology?

jobs.title: Payroll and People Operations Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hi, we’re Back Market.

We’re here to help make tech reliable, affordable, and better than new. We're a global marketplace for refurbished devices, helping lower our collective environmental impact by providing trustworthy, affordable tech with 92% less carbon emissions than new.

Yep, you read that right. Turns out refurbished tech is way better for the planet than new. In fact, With every device purchased on Back Market, our positive impact on the planet grows. From our Customer Care representatives to our software engineer, every individual at Back Market cuts the planet — and consumers — a break. Our mission is simple: to do more with what we already have.

Are you ready to join us?

We are offering an exceptional career opportunity to join our System and Payroll team in Barcelona. We have an ambitious roadmap involving automating the people operations (e.g. contracts preparation, onboarding and offboarding…) while expanding our in-house payroll expertise. We are looking for someone with a forward-thinking mindset and a taste for leveraging technology to achieve this roadmap and globally streamline HR functions.

As a Payroll and People Operations Specialist, reporting to the Lead Payroll & People Operations, you will be in charge of the automation of the people operations and of the payroll execution for both Spanish employees and international employees.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🏅


  • Smooth and friendly management of Payroll:

    • Deliver the accurate payroll run for your scope for our Spanish employees (90 and counting) and potentially UK and German employee with a payroll provider

    • Depending on profile, deliver payroll for French employee (internal payroll with ADP Decidium)

    • Participate to all the payroll and benefit impacts throughout the employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding in your scope.

    • Engage with our external payroll, benefits providers and local administration when needed.

    • Leverage on the capabilities of our tools stack including Workday as core HR system, Papaya Global as global payroll solution and potentially ADP Decidium for France.

    • Ensure that employees get a swift and friendly assistance meaning: answering questions, resolving issues, communicating changes proactively with a positive mindset and touch of humour when appropriate.

  • Automation of People Operations with Workday and AI tools:

    • Get trained in the automation of People Operations with Workday and potentially Dust, our AI tool.

    • Automate the production of all the HR documents (contract, certificate…) needed by all HR team

    • Prepare the documents needed by the HR Team (e.g. mainly HR Business Partners and Recruiters) with the help of your team.

    • Seek all opportunities to improve operational efficiency.

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐

  • You are enthusiastic and eager to open yourself to a new level of expertise

  • You have graduated from a degree in Human Resources, payroll, Accounting or Finance

  • You have already at least 2 years of experience in Spanish payroll

  • A knowledge of Workday, ADP Decidium or Papaya Global is a strong plus.

  • A previous experience in automation of administrative tasks is also a plus.

  • You have worked in a fast-growing and in an international environment.

  • You have great communication skills.

  • Excel/Gsheet is your best friend (or at least a very close relative).

  • You are structured and thorough with strong attention to details and data accuracy.

  • English is a no brainer.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Are you ready to join us?

Within the BoT (Bureau of Technology) department, the Platform tribe plays a central role in designing and maintaining the core technical components of our infrastructure, providing key tools, services, and solutions to support the development of our products and engineers.

The Data Platform team’s role is to design, build, and scale the data infrastructure, pipelines, and self-service tools to support data-driven decision making across all teams. Our goal is to enable our users — from raw data ingestion to actionable business intelligence.

As a Data Engineer within this team, you'll join a passionate group dedicated to removing data friction, automating complex processes, and accelerating analytics innovation across all our squads.

Your Mission

We are looking for an Experienced Data Engineer to help us build & operate a set of data services to support the growth of the business: you will help take care of the data collection, processing, and delivery infrastructure behind the scenes.

You will be working in an agile "build it and run it" environment where engineering teams build, launch, monitor, and support the product that they own.

What You'll Work On

  • Self-Service Data Platform: Build and improve the data ecosystem, making it seamless for analysts, scientists, developers and business users to access, explore, and analyze data independently.

  • Data Architecture & Engineering: Design and maintain scalable data pipelines, warehouses, and lake architectures that handle large volumes of internal and external data efficiently.

  • Collaboration: Work closely with Data Scientists, Analysts, Business teams, Marketing, and Product to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions for dashboards, reporting, and analytics.

  • Platform Reliability: Ensure the scalability, security, stability, and availability of our data infrastructure, implementing best practices for data governance and quality.

  • Automation & Optimization: Develop and automate data flows from ingestion to consumption, eliminating manual processes and ensuring data freshness and accuracy.

  • Cross-Platform Integration: Collaborate with other Platform teams (Infrastructure, Engineering Productivity, Code Foundations) to improve the overall developer experience.

Our Tech Stack

  • Python, SQL, Go

  • Apache Airflow (GCP Cloud Composer)

  • BigQuery, Kafka, dbt

  • Fivetran

  • GCP, Kubernetes, Terraform, Crossplane

  • Docker, Git, Bash

  • CI/CD (CircleCI/GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, etc).

What We're Looking For

  • Technical Excellence: You possess extensive experience in programming languages (Python preferred) and have knowledge of data infrastructure tools like data warehouses, streaming platforms, and orchestration systems, and you know about infrastructure-as-code approaches. Icing on the cake if you have experience in building and maintaining production data architectures with batch/streaming processing, working on cloud platforms (GCP knowledge is a plus).

  • Software Craftsmanship: You are eager to learn, follow best practices in software development, and embrace continuous improvement.

  • Problem-Solving Mindset: You're flexible and creative in tackling complex data challenges, with a pragmatic approach to balancing technical debt versus features and cost versus scalability

Team Player: You're well-organized, autonomous, rigorous, and thrive in distributed team environments with a strong collaborative spirit. You can clearly communicate technical concepts, challenges and results with teammates.

Hiring process

TA phone screen , 45 min
Technical interview , 60 min
Data culture interview, 60 min
Meet your manager, 45 min
BM values, 45 min

Do you dream of leading impactful projects that improve customer experience, boost quality and reduce costs? If so, we have the perfect internship for you! Join our dynamic team where innovation meets efficiency.   • Drive Adoption: Contribute to the adoption of the BackShip service among sellers and enhance the value proposition.

  • Data Enthusiasts: Strong analytical skills and a love for working with data (Excel has no secrets for you!). Knowledge of SQL or eagerness to learn is highly desirable.

  • Team Players: Capacity to work with transversal teams.

  • Experience: Previous experience in e-commerce, logistics, or a start-up is a plus.

  • Communicators: Excellent verbal and written communication in English (French is a plus, but not mandatory).

  • Adaptable: Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

  • Starting date: January 2026

  • Duration: 6 months

  • Full-time internship (35h/week - Monday to Friday)

  • Location: Paris, France

  1. Video-call Interview with the Talent Acquisition Specialist (30min)

  2. Live Case study & Technical Interview with the manager (45 mins)

  3. Cultural fit interview With a member of the team (30 min)

- A mission driven work environment where your day to day makes an impact on the planet. Seriously.

- Hybrid work environment, with 2 remote days a week and 1 remote work week per quarter, plus 3 flex days.

- Employee Resource Groups, including mentorship programs, comprehensive accessibility policies, and cultural competency training.

At Back Market, we strive to create a workplace that embodies the world we’re trying to change. We’ve embedded our diversity, equity, and inclusion principles into our DNA — from dedicated staff to employee resource groups to our company values.

We know that the perfect background for a role doesn’t mean the perfect fit — we encourage you to apply for a role even if you think you may not have all the qualifications.

If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

You’re at the stage of your career where mentoring and coaching other designers comes naturally to you. You’re developing deep areas of specialisation within your craft whilst demonstrating strong influence with cross-functional peers.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🥇

  • Being an equal partner with product managers and engineers to build, maintain, and evolve Back Market, with a focus on the Customer, Agent and Seller experiences through aftersales contacts.

  • Contribute to the roadmap and advocating for the right approach, prioritisation, and execution to ensure a best in class customer experience.

  • Collaborating with user researchers to bring clarity to ambiguous problems with relevant user insights, and consulting quantitative and qualitative data to inform your design decisions.

  • Advocating for and facilitating design methods and tools to help your team deliver solutions that actually work for our customers and the business.

  • Ensuring clarity and comprehension in your or your team’s proposed ideas and solutions from conception to delivery through useful documentation, effective collaboration and tidy working practices.

  • Proactively advocating your impact and autonomously communicating progress, learnings, and goals to the company and beyond.

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐

  • You are perfectly fluent in english as we are an international team.

  • You have extensive experience working in a growing design & research team and can talk about how you’ve worked with stakeholders to deliver impact in dynamic environments. B2B design experience is an advantage.

  • You demonstrate in-depth knowledge in design methods and craft. You have a collection of examples where you’d contributed to a successful impact.

  • You have your ear to the ground regarding new tools and technologies that help your work become more effective and efficient.

  • You have a passion to help our team grow. You can contribute inclusive design practices, are comfortable in voicing your opinion, and love mentoring and coaching others.

  • You are obsessive about UX or UI design. You have an attention to detail regarding edge cases, hierarchy, and contrast.

  • You deliver designs with a systematic approach.

  • You think about interfaces not as static pixels but as dynamic experiences and can express yourself with motion, flows and stories.

  • You are inherently curious, you are idealistic but you challenge the status quo responsibility and can always find the middle ground.

  • Actively contribute to our data model, working with our analytics engineers to enable greater self-service across our stakeholder community

  • Develop the use of LLMs & AI to capture the voice of our customers & gain insights that drive better customer service

  • You studying a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Management or STEM with specialization in data & analytics or equivalent

  • You have strong skills in data analytics, visualization and modeling, including experience with SQL & Gsheet ; ideally Tableau or DBT too!

  • You possess a good balance of statistical/technical skills balanced with business acumen.

  • You have good communication skills and you are able to make your work accessible to a non-technical audience

  • You know how to work in autonomy

  • You like to do concrete things and you are not afraid to get your hands dirty

  • You are an amazing team player with whom it’s always a pleasure to work

The User Research team’s mission is to help everybody at Back Market get to know and love our users so that we can create great experiences for them. We gather insights about what users need through a range of qualitative and quantitative techniques and translate them into valuable information for the product and design team.

As an User Research (UX) Intern, you will work on the e-commerce experience Back Market provides to its customers, using insights to provide actionable recommendations for improvements, as well as contributing to improve our research processes, tools, and communications. You will also work closely with our business and product teams to ensure a user -centered culture in our problem and solution definition.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🥇

  • Bring stakeholders (business people), designers, product owners and engineers together to build, maintain, and evolve a robust experience for Back Market’s customers

  • Listen to business problems and helping craft action plans

  • Conduct qualitative research to collect insights and build strong recommendations

  • Launch quantitative studies to discover trends and validate the hypothesis

  • Work closely with product designers to ensure that your recommendations have the maximum impact

  • Present the results of your work to the company and make sure that the value of research is understood

  • Contribute to the development of the UX Research team with your colleagues

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐

  • You are looking for a 6-month, full-time, internship based in Bordeaux, France, from January - June 2026

  • English is a no-brainer (fully professional capability) for you. If you’re extra cool and speak more languages, bonus points for you!

  • You have experience or convincing knowledge of best practices in conducting research (qualitative and quantitative research methods, such as usability testing, observational research, user interviews, surveys, card sorts, contextual inquiry, etc.)

  • You have strong presentation and communication skills.

  • You have e-commerce experience, that would be a plus but it's not required.

RECRUITMENT PROCESS: 📅

  • Video-call Interview with the Campus Talent Acquisition Specialist

  • Skills fit/Tech interview with the direct manager

  • Cultural fit interview with another person in the team

  • Proven project management experience and are able to coordinate between teams

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We’re here to help make tech reliable, affordable, and better than new. We're a global marketplace for refurbished devices, helping lower our collective environmental impact by providing trustworthy, affordable tech with 92% less carbon emissions than new.

Are you ready to join us?

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are seeking a Capacity Planner to join our Operations team and optimize how we manage our call center workforce. In this role, you'll focus on workforce planning and resource allocation to ensure our ~800 customer care agents across six BPO locations can meet customer demand efficiently while controlling costs. Your work will be essential to maintaining smooth operations across all Back Market's business units.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, solving complex operational challenges, and wants to contribute to Back Market's mission of making technology more sustainable through the circular economy.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🥇

Capacity Planning & Forecasting

  • Develop and maintain capacity planning models for Customer Care

  • Create demand forecasts based on historical data, seasonality, and business growth projections

  • Build and maintain workforce planning models, including staffing requirements and resource allocation

  • Collaborate with Finance team on budget planning and capacity investment decisions

  • Monitor and adjust capacity plans based on actual vs. forecasted performance

Data Analysis & Reporting

  • Track and analyze key performance indicators related to capacity utilization

  • Create and maintain dashboards and reports for stakeholders using Tableau, SQL, and Excel

  • Perform root cause analysis on capacity constraints and operational bottlenecks

  • Conduct scenario planning and "what-if" analyses for different business conditions

  • Support monthly, quarterly, and annual business reviews with capacity insights

Cross-functional Collaboration

  • Work closely with Operations, Finance, and Business teams to align capacity planning with business objectives

  • Support BPO (Business Partner Outsourced) management with capacity forecasting

  • Collaborate with BI team on data extraction, manipulation, and modeling needs

Process Improvement & Automation

  • Identify opportunities to automate capacity planning processes

  • Develop and improve forecasting methodologies and tools

  • Create documentation and training materials for capacity planning processes

  • Implement best practices for capacity management across the organization

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐

  • You are perfectly fluent in english

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research, or equivalent

  • 3-5 years of experience in capacity planning, workforce planning, operations analysis, or similar analytical role

  • Experience in fast-paced, high-growth environments (scale-up/startup preferred)

  • Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, complex formulas, financial modeling)

  • SQL proficiency for data extraction and analysis (Snowflake experience a plus)

  • Tableau or similar BI tools for dashboard creation and data visualization

  • Basic understanding of statistical forecasting methods

  • Experience with capacity planning tools and methodologies

  • Strong quantitative and analytical thinking

  • Ability to break down complex problems and identify root causes

  • Experience with P&L analysis and financial modeling

  • Understanding of operational metrics and KPIs

  • Attention to detail with exceptional accuracy

  • Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple projects simultaneously

  • Strong project management skills with ability to meet deadlines

  • Collaborative mindset with ability to work across different teams

  • Results-oriented with focus on continuous improvement

Are you ready to join us?

We zoom out to see the bigger picture, but also understand that the devil is in the details. We are responsible for the user experience on Back Market, whether it involves our customers or professional refurbishers. Through designing, prototyping, testing, and iterating, we evolve it in collaboration with different (and extraordinary) people.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to join us to make Back Market the most successful destination for buying refurbished products in Japan.

You’ll collaborate with our Engineers, Product Designers, User Researchers, and Content Designers to bring a plethora of concepts and product evolution, you’ll work on a daily basis with developers to validate the technical feasibility of your proposals and to ensure the fulfillment of your craft, and you’ll also be connected with other Back Markets functions (Marketing, Brand, Business etc.) to help articulate the needs and expectations of the customer and the business.

As a Senior minded PM, you’ll autonomously own the product vision for our Japan Market, meaning creating new features and innovative journeys for Japanese citizens, taking into consideration their specific needs, which might vary from EU or US.

You will also manage the relationships with business stakeholders and other product managers to deliver impactful results.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 🥇

  • You create your squad’s vision and are responsible for defining the Northstar metrics and KPIs, which drive the team toward concrete goals and impacts.

  • You are the entry point for all stakeholders in Japan, especially the Japan General Manager and Marketing Director, to help you understand the short and long-term priorities: you liaise with them to ensure your product fits perfectly into the Back Market experience.

  • You are the Engineering Manager’s daily partner: you adjust priorities if needed, and your communication skills and ability to collaborate with engineers ensure our quality standards and commitments are met.

  • The product management skills have no secret for you; you master the discovery steps (link with research, design, data), as well as delivery (testing and QA are part of the game!).

  • You communicate clearly and regularly about the risks and impacts of your roadmap and features, knowing how to anticipate problems and dependencies to ensure a smooth delivery.

  • Data is your best friend: data drives your decisions and vision… You never work without data!

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ⭐

  • You have strong Product Manager experience (minimum 3-4 years) and are comfortable working with Product Designers, UX researchers, and Engineering teams.

  • You have product management experience in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.), and you are able to shape product discovery and delivery according to agile principles.

  • You have a good understanding of the Japanese market and, more specifically, ecommerce behaviours and trends in Japan: PayPay or Rakuten do not have any secrets for you.

  • You are a brilliant communicator; your peers define you as a facilitator and leader. Your interpersonal skills will be crucial for that role to build strong relationships with stakeholders and top management.

  • You have a problem-solver attitude, comfortable navigating ambiguous situations using data and putting the user at the centre of all your thoughts.

  • Your native language is Japanese, and you are comfortable communicating professionally in English, as we are an international team.

  • You have an analytical mind, and even better, an analytics background. Monitoring our key performance indicators / being able to define targeted increments is part of your daily life. Data is your secret weapon to better frame and measure the quality of our features and increments.

  • You use common sense. You have a strategic but simple vision of your product. For you, the product must amplify the value of business expectations.

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US? ✌🏼

At Back Market, we’re committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives — it’s one of the reasons we’re such a high-scoring certified B Corp company (93.2).

No matter your role and seniority level, you’ll enjoy impact-driven work with hands-on career development in an innovative, driven, and fast-paced environment, with benefits to match, like:

  • A mission-driven work environment where your day-to-day makes an impact on the planet. Seriously.

  • Hybrid work environment, with 2 remote days a week and 1 remote work week per quarter, plus 3 flex days.

  • Employee Resource Groups, including mentorship programs, comprehensive accessibility policies, and cultural competency training.


At Back Market, we strive to create a workplace that embodies the world we’re trying to change. We’ve embedded our diversity, equity, and inclusion principles into our DNA, from dedicated staff to employee resource groups to our company values.

We know that the perfect background for a role doesn’t mean the perfect fit, we encourage you to apply for a role even if you think you may not have all the qualifications.

If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.
